result.execSummary:
The defendant Solomon T Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 07-20-2016 or civil judgment.
With credit for 3 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Solomon T Armstrong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Solomon T Armstrong in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 
Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 7-20-2016 or civil judgment.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests a Scheduling Conference for reasons placed on the record. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Solomon T Armstrong in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23 at request of defense.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Solomon T Armstrong in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Solomon T Armstrong in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a status conferenc date.  Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Solomon T Armstrong
Current: 2554 N. 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 05-21-2015)
Prior: 4232 N. 28th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Solomon T Armstrong in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-21-2015 at 1:30pm
